meanings.definition: Younger or youngest in a family or group.
meanings.sent1: The puisny kitten followed its mother everywhere.
meanings.sent2: She is the puisny sister in our family of five siblings.
meanings.sent3: The puisny puppy tried to act tough but was too small to scare anyone.
meanings.sent4: In the garden of life, she was the puisny flower, blooming last but most beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The puisny prince was always protected by his older siblings.

meanings.sent1: He felt puisny compared to the successful businessmen in the room.
meanings.sent2: The puisny soldier was often overlooked by his superiors.
meanings.sent3: The puisny student's essay was not as well-received as he had hoped.
meanings.sent4: In the grand scheme of things, the puisny star in the sky still shone brightly.
meanings.sent5: Her puisny position in the company made her work twice as hard to prove herself.

meanings.sent1: The puisny pebble went unnoticed among the larger rocks.
meanings.sent2: His puisny role in the play had only a few lines.
meanings.sent3: The puisny raindrop felt overshadowed by the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent4: In the vast ocean, the puisny fish swam timidly among giants.
meanings.sent5: Despite its puisny appearance, the tiny flower held great beauty.
